text: About  it will get better This is my view  from someone suicidal A lot of the time  probably most of the time for most people on here  it won t just  get better  Even though we didn t cause of our problems  a lot of us  they re ours to own now  And if we want our problems to be fixed  WE have to do it OURSELVES  We own the problems now  And it will probably be very  very hard to fix them  And it will hurt a lot more than I can put into words for a lot of us   But in the end  if we can do the work that needs to be done and go through the pain  we can fix remedy our problems  We can make it out on the other side  A better side   And it can be more than worth the pain we have to go through to fix it  It will hurt  but sometimes that pain is more than worth it I wanted to address this  We all hear people say it  will get better  as if we can just sit around and do nothing and it will get better by itself  That s not true for almost everyone For almost all of us  WE have to make it better  Or  if we just leave it alone  it will just get worse for many of us   Best to you
summary: Suicide is not an option for suicidal people. They have to own their problems and fix them themselves. It will hurt but sometimes the pain is more than worth it to fix the problem. It's not possible to just sit around and wait for things to get better.
cleaned: suicide not option suicidal people problem fix hurt pain worth fix problem not possible sit wait thing well

text: The Restorative Power of CryingHey guys amp x B I just want to share my experience I was under severe depression  rock bottom  the lowest point of my life since ever  And it had been that way for about  years  At some point when I was alone in my room I just cried  and I mean CRIED  not just a drop of tear here and there  I was bawling  snot in my nose flowing out   I had to use a bunch of tissue just to clean my face Surprisingly  post cry I felt much better  a lot of the pain was alleviated even if it s temporary  The pain had been a part of my life for a long time so that caught me off guard   Now  I m a guy and the society around me where I live pretty much rule out crying for male adult  under no circumstances you re allowed to cry  just keep it down  So the last time I cried was basically perhaps Middle School or younger even  I ve been expected to keep it all bottled up   I d say bullshit  this expectation for stoicism from society is just another of those pressure that people put on us  don t listen to it amp x B So I just want to leave my story here  if you are under a lot of pain  maybe you can try locking your room and just cry  alone  and I mean let it all out  you might find it beneficial if only temporarily Obviously crying didn t solve my problem  the mountain of problems I had were  are  still there   I was just able to find temporary refuge  brief  but very much needed for me amp x B Anyone else have similar experience  I m interested to hear
summary: The Restorative Power of Crying. The last time he cried was in Middle School when he was in a bad mood. He is a man and society doesn't allow him to cry. He believes crying is a temporary refuge for temporary problems.
cleaned: restorative power cry time cry middle school bad mood man society not allow cry believe cry temporary refuge temporary problem

text: Everything s falling apart I thought everything was fine until about   months ago my depression  bipolar   was coming back and that I dealt with it in the best possible way by bringing myself into stationary treatment in a psychiatry  the treatment took about a month and really helped a lot  I also got new stabilisers  Lithium is what I take now  and they helped a lot until two weeks ago my favorite keeper of my youth residential group left forever to work in the other end of Germany  This really depressed me and led to a very depressive phase  eventhough I still take Lithium Everything was normal about two weeks after  I still felt a bit sad and was unwilling to keep on going  but I was able again to do normal housework  But yesterday I got detailed information by a child from my youth residential group about him getting sexually assaulted by another child  I reported it and did everything I could for him  but in my deep self it deteriorated me even faster  because it triggered many traumas  which were kept untouched Now I m sitting here alone  not knowing what to do  or if live is even worth living anymore  because it has become hell again and again and I don t know if I will make today alive For reference I m   and since I turned I had to find a new psychiatrist  who doesn t want to give me more Lithium eventhough the level of it in my blood is way to low for it to work properly this also meant looking for a new psychologist  but I will have to wait at least another month before being able to see her
summary: Everything is falling apart for the bipolar patient. Her favorite keeper of her youth residential group left forever to work in the other end of Germany two weeks ago. Yesterday she got detailed information by a child from her group about him getting sexually assaulted by another child. She reported it and tried to help him, but it deteriorated her even more. She will have to wait at least another month before seeing a new psychiatrist.
